answers.answer: I had a csection. My advice is don't push yourself. Take everything slow and easy. I didn't and I regret it. I wish you luck and hope it goes great :)
Don't worry to much about It I had it they just check your sugar when you get there and after you eat they also check your babys sugar. My son came out to be 5lb 15oz
NJmomma did they give you a measurement of your baby?

question: I went for a routine checkup yesterday and I just found out that I have Gestational Diabetes. I am beyond angry with this doctors office because I will be 36 weeks tomorrow. My fundal height is measuring at 40 weeks and my growth scan registered the baby at nearly 10 lbs 6 oz. They were trying to get me to go up to about 39 weeks since there is no medical issue with me. I had a NST done as well as another scan which registered him being at 9 lbs 2 oz last night. After 8 hours of being at the Doctors, I now have a scheduled c-section at 38 weeks which is the 21st. Can anyone give me any advice on c-sections or babies born to mothers that have GD? I am so worried.
title: IN DESPERATE NEED OF ADVICE!!!
